activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Nerling

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
COVERS 22CF233 & 22CF240
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Defendant. The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.

Court finds probable cause and binds over on both cases. 
If released, Defendant must appear in person, for next hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed to 22CF233 & 22CF240 also.  $25.00 per month starts 11/25/2022.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:06 PM Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

THIS COVERS 22CF240, 22CF233, 22CF205, and 22CF200

22CF200 & 22CF205 - Set for prelim before Judge Bitney on 10/19/2022 at 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM. 
22CF233 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton with the same terms as her appointment in the underlying files (22CF205/200). Set for prelim before Judge Babler on 10/19/2022 at 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM. 
22CF240 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton with the same terms as her appointment in the underlying files (22CF205/200). Set for prelim before Judge Babler on 10/19/2022 at 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM.

1:13 Parties in a break out room. 1:15 Parties return and court sets bond. Must appear in person at the next hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
